bioghist.p: Phyllis Pray Bober (1920-2002) was a scholar of Renaissance art. She graduated from Wellesley College in 1941 and received her master's and doctoral degrees from the Institute of Fine Arts of New York University. She was a Dean of the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences at Bryn Mawr College from 1973 to 1980 and was a professor in the History of Art and the Classical and Near Eastern Archaeology departments until 1991. After her retirement she continued to write and lecture. She had a lifelong interest in culinary history and much of her later work focuses on this subject.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the professional papers of Phyllis Pray Bober. The materials include lecture notes and drafts, typescript articles, course notes, correspondence, notebooks and other records from Bober's undergraduate and graduate courses, and audio cassettes of a series of lectures delivered in 1986.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
